runs.comm: outswinger, just a little bit of movement, outside off, left alone
gets closer to off, shaping back in, defended to mid-off
wide length ball, shapes back in, but not enough to threaten him, and he has driven it on the up, between mid-off and cover. All along the ground
length ball outside off, runs it down to third man for one
perfect outswinger, around off, dipping, shaping away, defended to cover
nice outswinger again, Stirling stays in the crease to defend
drives a length ball on the up, but Rossouw has misfielded at cover
on a length, outside off, holds its line, left alone

big lbw shout as this swings back from middle and leg and beats him to hit him in front. Not given by Steve Davis. Two questions here. Where does it pitch? What is it hitting? Pitched within, says Hawkeye. Hitting leg, says Hawkeye. South Africa don't review, though
worked away off the pads, but finds square leg
short of a length, outside off, punched to cover
looks to pull but this is not short enough, and is beaten. This is the shot of a man chasing 400
short of a length, outside off, gets some room as this moves away, and punched away past cover for four
another similar boundary. Short of a length again, and this time he opens the face on the on-the-up drive to beat cover on the other side
stays short of a length again, but this time the third man has moved squarer and keeps them down to one
this one shapes top swing back in but keeps on going with the angle after pitching, runs this down to third man for one

he has got him, yeah?. Stirling is almost walking, but Ranmore Martinesz has missed his second edge of the day. Short of a length, swinging away, Stirling is squared up, there is a sound as the ball passes the bat, there is defelction, and there is a register on the snicko. This has to be overturned. Fourth bad decision of the day - two each from both umpires. Three have been overturned. South Africa didn't review the fourth
bouncer, and he ducks under it
loose drive against a wide length ball, almost an inside edge
short of a length, on off, angling across, left alone
pulled away, shouts of catch it, but it has flown wide of the diving Steyn at short fine leg
short of a length, on off, punched to mid-off
short of a length, wide, punched away, but can't beat the diving man at cover

gone, they have got Porterfield. Faf du Plessis is the man at short midwicket. A length ball, on the pads, and he has instinctively just flicked at it. This is dying on du Plessis, but he takes a smart low catch
a length ball outside off, pushed to cover
sharp bouncer, on off, getting it really high, 144ks, Joyce stays under it and doesn't want to look at it

that's the old one-two. Bouncer has pushed Joyce back, and he bowls a full one at 146ks to follow it up. The bouncer has done it. Joyce stays back, the feet don't move, he plays away from the body, nowhere near the pitch of the ball, and edges it through to first slip
bouncer, Balbarine doesn't want any part of it. Stays inside its line, which is just outside off
goes for the yorker, but ends up too straight and too full. Balbarine clips this low full toss away for four
bouncer to end the over as Balbarine ducks it
short of a length, angling across him, opens the face on it, Miller makes a diving save at backward point
fuller, on the pads, tucked away for a single
on a length, headed towards top of off, Balbarine not quite behind its line. Defends from the crease
short of a length, outside off, pushed with an open face, to point
outswinger, floated outside off, sucker ball, at 138ks, draws him into the drive, and the ball swings away late to beat his bat
lovely delivery. Abbott is good. On a length, from slightly wide on the crease, close enough to make him play, but then the ball holds its line against the angle, and beats the outside edge
full, on the pads, clipped away for one
loose drive at a wide length ball, and the thick edge flies to third man
short of a length, on the stumps, he plays the flick-pull with the front leg in the air. Gets it over square leg
lovely shot. Short of a length, just outside off, and he has punches this beautifully between cover and extra cover for four

now the bouncer, the retribution from the fast man, gets it head high, O'Brien goes ahead with the hook, and the top edge falls safely in the fine leg area. Tahir is at long leg, takes a bit of time sweeping, and Steyn is not happy a second has been conceded
another head-high bouncer, and this time O'Brien pulls out of the pull at the last moment. A wise decision too. Difficult to control them from up there
short of a length, angling in, 143ks, defended from the crease
weak pull to a shortish delivery, finds square leg
short of a length, good carry from that length. Bowled at 146ks. Balbirnie has no clue about this, and just hangs his bat limply out. Lucky to not edge it
another weak pull from outside off, finds mid-on
short of a length, outside off, extra bounce, 145ks, and Balbirnie is all at sea, flailing limply at these deliveries

Behardien has misjudged this slightly. Morkel again gets this rising rib high from just short of a length, a weak pull follows, and Behardien at square leg is lobbed. He never makes an attempt to catch it over the shoulder. He back-pedals and tries to catch it one-handed. And is lobbed
angling in, short of a length, worked away for a single to leg
short, not too high, and O'Brien pulls this from the line of off. Over square leg, and easily played

that's a great catch by Amla. Absolutely fantastic. O'Brien throws his bat at a wide length ball, gets a healthy edge towards first slip, de Kock goes for it, deflects it, Amla's view is blocked, and he has not even half a second to adjust. Actually he has got lucky. The deflection off de Kock's glove has settled in his armpit. De Kock's glove to Amla's left hand to his right armpit
short of a length, angling in, hits his thigh pad
stays back in the crease to defend a length ball
short of a length, outside off, hangs his bat out there, lucky to not edge it
short of a length, outside off, defended from the crease
short of a length, angling in, defended to midwicket
finally gets the pull going. Short outside off, doesn't get too high, and he swivel-pulls it over midwicket. Balbirnie feeling more at home now
Morkel bowls a peach. Length between short of a length and good length. Then the Morkel bounce. This can get the best of the batsmen out. Balbirnie gets away with just getting beaten
similar length but into the pads, worked away for a single
short of a length, outside off, runs this down to third man

another wicket. They discuss reviewing this, but Wilson walks off without challenging Martinesz's decision. Wilson is crease-bound, almost expecting a short ball, the length ball nips back in and hits him on the knee roll. The line is perfect, the only question is the height. In the worst case, the Hawkeye might return umpire's call on this. That's what it does
on a length, angling in towards top of off. Defended

the non-striker has dropped his bat as Abbott is about to delivery. He is trying to back up, and it gets stuck in some ridge or something. O'Brien has seen this, defended the ball, and can't stop laughing at his mate
length ball, angling in, defended to leg
full, on off, driven to mid-off
short of a length, rising towards the chest, hits the outer half of his bat
short of a length again but wide, easily punched away for a couple, straight of third man
short-arm pull from around rib high, gets a single
short of a length, on off, opens the face in defence
short of a length, outside off, swings away after passing the stumps. De Kock dives to his right to collect
on a length, around off, defended from the crease
wide length ball, driven off the outside half for a single
bouncer, around off, at 139ks, and he ducks it
short of a length, on off, stays back to defend
short of a length, wide outside off, beats the toe end as it stays low
sharp bouncer that doesn't rise as much as expected. Bowled at 144ks. On the stumps. He has to act fast to avoid it
short of a length, outside off, pushed wide of point for a risky single, but there is no direct hit
good bounce from just short of a length. He is looking to pull but pulls out at the last moment
wants the fuller one, misses the yorker, concedes a single with a low full toss. Wide of mid-on
on a length, angling in, pushed to mid-on
short of a length, widish, looks to cut, but the ball has come on faster than he expects. Ends up bunting it in front of square
uppish with the punch, but it doesn't carry to cover
short of a length, just outside off, defended from the crease
starts with a full toss, driven to long-on for one
googly already, but too full, driven to long-off for one
length ball, legbreak, on off, defended back to him
toppie there, he gets inside the line, is clipped on the pad, and goes for a leg-bye
sweeps a really full one without really getting down. From in front of leg. But he has placed this well
tossed up outside off, a late decision to try to sweep it, beaten outside off
short of a length, wide, punched away to deep cover
shouts of catch it as he has played this uppishly to his left. Behardien is slowish to react, gets a finger to it
pushed to mid-on off a length
short of a length, angling in, opens the face, gets a single
short of a length, outside off, defended to cover
on a length, on off, pushed to mid-off for one
low full toss on the pads, swept away over square leg for four
flighted on off, driven to long-off
googly, turning in towards off, driven to mid-off
swept away, gets an edge fine of short fine leg
on a length, middle and leg, worked to square leg
on a length, middle and leg, straightens a touch, defended to mid-on
length ball angling into the pads, worked past square leg
driven on the up, to deep cover
swinging in a little, pushed back to Behardien
driven down to long-on for one
short of a length, middle and leg, punched to long-on for one
short of a length, wide, poor delivery although the runs have come of an outside edge
googly, he has read it, and defended it right back
flat length ball, defended from the crease
googly, opens the face, defended
tossed up outside off, beats his sweep
driven to long-off for one
googly, defended off the front foot. No patience from Tahir. Against good batsman, you have to first set them up with legbreaks before bowling the googly
short of a length, offbreak, punched to long-on for one
another shortish offbreak, KOB is early into this attempted pull. Beaten but it is headed down leg
swept away for a single
punched down to long-on for one
makes room to punch this wide of cover. He has taken this from outside leg
defended back uppishly to the bowler
legbreak, just outside off, he has read it well and left it alone
googly, starts wide of off, hasn't spent time setting him up. Beats him, though
quicker fuller ball, worked away for one to leg
flighted on middle and leg, concedes a leg-bye as KOB looks to sweep
another googly, worked away for an easy single off the pads
tossed up outside off, driven to long-off for one
down the wicket to chip this length-ball offbreak for a single
pulled away to long leg
length-ball offbreak for a single to midwicket
short again, pulled away to deep midwicket
on a length, into the pads, worked away for a single to leg
tossed up wide outside off, he drives hard at it and gets an outside edge. 50 for the partnership, Ireland's highest against South Africa
full outside leg, no turn, goes for five wides
on a length, middle and leg, played to square leg
short of a length, outside off, defended
short of a length again, punched away for a single
pitches middle and leg, doesn't turn, beats the inside edge, goes for a leg-bye
on a length, punched down to long-on for one
not much turn, shortish, cut away, but can't beat cover-point
on a length, just outside off, defended with an open face
bouncer, just outside off, he stays away from its line. Morkel takes a tumble, but is fine
short of a length, just outside off, pushed with an open face to point
makes room and Morkel follows him. He pushes at it, and gets a thick edge, wide of the slip
nicely played. Short of a length, wide, punched away, and timed beautifully to send this away for a four between cover-point and cover. Balbirnie brings up a fifty after a shaky start
short of a length, angling in, defended to mid-on
flighted on off, legbreak, defended back to him
driven to long-on for one
full, middle and leg, swept away without actually going down on a knee, gets a single
slogged away for a six wide of long-on. In the slot for that shot. On a length, just outside off. De Villiers from long-on just goes flying even though he is in no position to get a touch on that
short of a length, outside off, punched away to deep cover for one
on a length, on off, defended back to him
bouncer, ducks under it
on a length, angling in, defended to leg
flicked away off the pads for a single
lovely shot. That is a really difficult shot. This is short of a length and rising, but Balbirnie has punched this in front of square. One of the most difficult shots to play in the book
and he gets too adventurous. Drags this pull shot from well outside off and finds deep midwicket with perfection. Valiant effort, will do the net run rate a world of good
bouncer, outside off, ducks under it. Called a wide on height
short of a length, looks to work this to leg, beaten, but this is headed down leg
short of a length, on off, punched to leg for one
short of a length, outside off, punched to cover
down the wicket to drive this straight of long-off for two
worked to leg for a single
he gets on a knee to ramp this over the keeper's head for a single
flat legbreak without any turn, looks to cut but there is no room
Mooney tries the reverse sweep and is beaten by the dipping legbreak
stays back to defend a length ball
full, on off, dug out to cover
perfect legbreak, just that it has started a touch too straight and is headed down leg when it hits the pad after beating the bat
paddles this fine for a couple
looks to reverse-sweep this, the ball turns away from his new right-hand stance, and gets a bottom edge onto his body
down the wicket to drive this full toss over cover for four
fullish, on off, chipped back over his head for a couple
driven to long-off for a single
backs away to drive this through cover, is beaten by the lack of spin here
down the wicket to work this wide of fine leg
flat delivery, hits him on the pad as he looks to work this to leg
drives this inside-out for a single
worked to deep midwicket for one
driven to deep cover
pushed down to long-on for one
flighted legbreak, looks to drive this over cover, beaten
googly, defended to leg
and he has a wicket second ball. Short of a length, angling away, innocuous little delivery, Mooney looks to play a forceful shot, and ends up dragging it on. Is there anything AB can't do nowadays?
short of a length, outside off, punched to third man for one
short ball, long hop, pulled away for a four to square leg
appeal for a catch at the wicket. This is short of a length, wide, squeezes under the bat. Not given, not reviewed

wide down the leg side, and an appeal for a stumping. Nice collection outside leg, the back foot moves, but not in the air for too long. Interestingly, amid all the confusion, it hasn't been called a wide
short of a length, outside off, punched to cover
flighted outside off, pushed to cover
the wide line outside off gives it away that this is a googly. Defended to point
quicker straighter delivery, defended to cover
slower through the air, legbreak, from leg, defended to leg
another legbreak, defended off the back foot
short of a length, on off, pushed to mid-off
short, pulled away to deep square for one
short of a length, angling in, defended to leg
short of a length, in front of off, defended to leg
bouncer with the keeper up. De Kock collects it problem free
fuller, middle and leg, worked away for a single
short of a length, outside off, punched to cover
overpitched, driven straight to mid-off
lovely shot. Mid-off is up, he knows it, gives him the charge and makes some room, and then lofts this legbreak over mid-off
legbreak, around off, hits the outer half of the bat
full and straight, no turn, well kept out by Dockrell
length ball, legbreak, pushed to cover
gets a leading edge as he looks to work this to leg. It goes past cover for one
wide outswinger, runs this down to third man for one
short of a length, outside off, he wants to have nothing to do with it
outswinger this time, just outside off, Dockrell is beaten
goes cross seam with a short ball, down the leg side, not called a wide. The small crowd boos the umpire. This is the second leg-side wide Martinesz has missed
on a length, on off, defended from the crease
wide down the leg side first ball

O'Brien misses out on a half-century. Abbott has four wickets now. Digs this one in short, from the sound the pull generates it seems he has smoked this, but it has hit him high on the bat and has found deep midwicket with precision
short of a length, outside off, punched to mid-off
rather sharp this. Short of a length, headed towards top of off. Defended from the crease
short of a length, rising towards the ribs, defended
short of a length, around chest high, drops it behind point for one
on a length, just outside off, pushed to cover
wide length ball, beats his drive
short of a length, on off, defended from the crease
bouncer, outside off, he stays inside its line
short of a length, rising towards the chest, fended off well
full, on off, runs off the outer half of the bat
short of a length, outside off, pushed to cover
short of a length, angling in, fended off with his toes in the air
bouncer, he drops his wrists and stays inside the line
fuller, he punches this off the back foot, but straight to cover
tries the yorker, gives him a low full toss, pushed wide of mid-off for one
short of a length, outside off, he ends up playing outside the line and is beaten on the inside edge
full swinging delivery, runs off the inside half of the bat
on a length, just outside off, defended from the crease

dropped. This is a wide length ball, he has thrown his bat at it, and Miller has let this burst through hands at point. This is head high, and only just to his right. Gets both hands to it to provide it a gateway
pushed wide of mid-off for one
he has hit him on the forearm. And Sorensen is not even wearing an armguard. He has ducked this short ball, but it doesn't rise, and it hits him on the wrist
short of a length, wide, cut away to third man
short outside off, and he stays away from it
length ball, on the pads, punched to midwicket
no turn on this, hits his pad, but hasn't straightened enough to threaten a leg-before
drives this to Tahir's left but he puts a dive in
another telegraphed googly, and he has been slogged over mid-on for four
wide half-volley, driven past cover for four
length ball, legbreak, pushed to midwicket
short of a length, angling in, defended back for him
short of a length again, straight at the body, defended
wide down the leg side. Martinesz gets a mock cheer from the crowd as he finally calls a wide down the leg side

AB has missed the stumps. This is hit just to his left at short cover, and Sorensen is gone by miles if AB hits. This is a wide throw, though. This has slipped out: he shouts Noooo as the ball leaves his hand
short of a length, rib high, defended
rising in towards the chest again, and Sorensen fends it off into his ribs
low full toss, middle and leg, defended to leg
short of a length, cut away, but straight to 12th man Phangiso at cover
down the wicket to chip this legbreak over cover for one
wide half-volley, absolutely smashed past the right ear of the umpire for a four
huge. Tahir is getting some stick here. Tossed up outside off, Sorense clears his front leg, and smashes this down the ground again
flat, into the pads, worked past midwicket for one
down the wicket to drive this to long-off for one
short of a length, on off, defended from the crease
short of a length, on off, defended to cover
short of a length, outside off, hits the inside half on the bat
bouncer, beats his top edge as Dockrell looks to upper-cut
but Morkel pitches it up, and is clipped away for a single to bring up the 200
ouch. This is at his hip, Sorensen has nowhere to go, he looks away throws his hands in defence. Off the bat handle it goes for an easy catch to the keeper
on a length, headed for top of off, defended back to him
short of a length, on off, opens the face, gets a single
length ball angled across him, beats the edge as he looks to cut
short of a length, pitched outside leg, defended in front of off
wide length ball, driven past those catching men for two
drives at a length ball but fails to get an edge
into the rib from round the wicket, drops it down safely
again into the hip, and he makes room to pull this over the leg-side field. Not many sweeping the boundary when you have slips and short leg in
wide down the leg side
short of a length, just outside off, left alone
looks for a yorker, middle and leg, dug out to square leg
makes room too take this from outside leg, places it wide of slip
finally it is over. He hits the top of off as Dockrell makes room to try to hit him over cover. Dockrell is expecting another ball in the ribs, but Morkel has gone straight and full
